lines:
1956

20 February, 1917.

r. SS. Kwan 
96 St. James Ave.

Boston, Mass,

My dear air:

For the past few days Dr. Stearns has been confined to

his home with a very severe cold;, and his physician does not wish

his to venture out for several days to come.

He feels, therefore,

that he will be unable to address the Cosmopolitan Club as he had

been planning to do, and wishes me to send you his deepest ro -
gets at not being able to accept your kind invitation.

He also

hopes that you will try him again at a later date.

Yours very truly,

Assistant to the Principal.
raw: 1956  20 February, 1917.  r. SS. He feels, therefore,  that he will be unable to address the Cosmopolitan Club as he had  been planning to do, and wishes me to send you his deepest rogets at not being able to accept your kind invitation.  He also  hopes that you will try him again at a later date.  Yours very truly,  Assistant to the Principal.

metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Letter stating that Dr. Stearns has been ill with a cold and deeply regrets that he will not be able to address the Cosmopolitan Club event.
metadata.note_acquisition: Phillips Academy Archives and Special Collections received the letters and materials of Sung Sing Kwan from Alfred E. Stearns in ____(date)
